type

Class Context<S,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • type.Context<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - Symbol representation
    T - Type representation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FnContext, TypeContext, VarContext

    public abstract class Context<S,T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Persistent implementation of a generic symbol table. Reinforces uniqueness of symbols. This class is backed by the PCollections library, which offers several implementations of persistent data structures. Since cloning is cheap, we can afford to cache the symbol table while traversing the AST.
    See Also:
    FnContext, TypeContext, VarContext

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Context()
      Default constructor initializes a single empty map

      • lookup

        public T lookup(S s)
        Traverses the context and searches for an existing binding to Key k
        Parameters:
        s - Symbol to search for
        Returns:
        Type t if it exists in this context, else null

      • add

        public void add(S s,
                T t)
         throws TypeException
        Adds a unique binding to this context
        Parameters:
        s - Symbol to add
        t - Type to bind s to
        Throws:
        TypeException - if Symbol s is already bound in this context

      • contains

        public boolean contains(S s)
        Checks if Symbol s is bound in this context
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if s is bound, else false
